B. REFER TO FX004 FOR IMPAIRMENT AND FIRE WATCH REQUIREMENTS. 
C. REFER TO FX004 FOR DEMOLITION NOTES AND REQUIREMENTS. 
D. THE DRAWING SHALL NOT BE SCALED FOR CONSTRUCTION PURPOSES. THE SCALE INDICATED IS 
INTENDED FOR "GENERAL REFERENCE ONLY". 
E. EXISTING FIRE SPRINKLERS SHALL REMAIN IN SERVICE AS LONG AS POSSIBLE, WHILE DEMOLITION 
WORK IS IN PROGRESS. ANY DISRUPTIONS IN THE FIRE SPRINKLER SYSTEM SERVICE SHALL BE 
PROVIDED WITH AN APPROVED FIRE WATCH OR STANDBY PERSONNEL. 
F. REMOVE ALL EXISTING FIRE SPRINKLERS IN THE AREAS INDICATED ON THIS SHEET AND CUT AND 
CAP THE PIPING BACK TO THE CONNECTION OF THE ARM OVER . FOR FLEXIBLE HOSE 
CONNECTIONS, REUSE OF THE FLEXIBLE HOSE IS AT THE CONTRACTOR'S RISK; CAP THE OPEN PIPE 
AT THE FLEXIBLE HOSE CONNECTION TO THE SPRINKLER PIPING. 
G. ANY EXISTING PIPE OR DUCTWORK INSULATION THAT IS DAMAGED DURING CONSTRUCTION SHALL 
BE REMOVED AND REPLACED WITH NEW INSULATION TO MATCH ADJACENT INSULATION AND 
COVERING AT THE FIRE PROTECTION CONTRACTOR'S EXPENSE. 
H. THE FIRE SUPPRESSION CONTRACTOR SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR FIELD VERIFYING EXISTING 
CONDITIONS PRIOR TO CONSTRUCTION. EXISTING SPRINKLER HEAD LOCATIONS WILL NEED TO BE 
FIELD VERIFIED BY FIRE SUPPRESSION CONTRACTOR. 
I. EXISTING FIRE SUPPRESSION SUPPLY SHALL BE DRAINED PRIOR TO ANY DEMOLITION WORK ON 
THE WET PIPE SPRINKLER SUPPLY FROM THE INDIVIDUAL FLOOR CONTROL VALVE TO THE MOST 
REMOTE SPRINKLER HEAD. 
J. EXISTING FLOOR CONTROL VALVE SHALL BE SECURED / CLOSED FOR DEMOLITION AND NEW WORK. 
K. ALL WORK SHALL BE PERFORMED SO AS TO NOT INTERRUPT SERVICE TO THE ENTIRE AFFECTED 
FLOOR. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL PROPERLY NOTIFY THE BUILDING OWNER AS APPLICABLE A 
MINIMUM OF 1 WEEK IN ADVANCE BEFORE PROCEEDING WITH THIS WORK. 
L. REMOVE ALL UNUSED AND DEMOLISHED EQUIPMENT AND ASSOCIATED MATERIAL FROM THE SITE. 
ABANDONING UNUSED PORTIONS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTABLE. OWNER SHALL HAVE THE RIGHT OF 
REFUGE OWNERSHIP OF ALL DEMOLISHED AND UNUSED PORTION OF EQUIPMENT AND MATERIALS. 
M. AVOID DAMAGING EXISTING SURFACES AND EQUIPMENT AND ASSOCIATED MATERIALS FROM THE 
SITE. REPAIR ANY DAMAGE CAUSED DURING WORK AT NO EXTRA COST TO THE OWNER. 
N. ALL SYSTEMS ARE TO BE LEFT IN SERVICE PRIOR TO THE END OF EACH WORK DAY. 
O. REMOVE ANY CEILING TILES, GRID, AND LIGHT FIXTURES REQUIRED TO ACCOMPLISH THE WORK. 
REPLACE SAME AFTER THE INSTALLATION IS COMPLETE. IT IS THE CONTRACTOR ’S RESPONSIBILITY 
TO REPLACE ANY ITEMS DAMAGED DURING CONSTRUCTION. 
P. REMOVE ALL ABANDONED PIPING, WET SPRINKLERS, FITTINGS, HANGERS, ETC., FROM THE 
PROJECT LOCATION. DISPOSE OF ALL MATERIAL LEGALLY TO AN APPROVED DISPOSAL SITE. 
Q. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL FIELD VERIFY ALL EXISTING ELECTRICAL LINES, PLUMBING LINES, 
DUCTWORK OR MECHANICAL PIPING LOCATED IN THE CEILING SPACE, WALLS OR FLOOR PRIOR TO 
SAW CUTTING OR ANY CORE DRILLING. IT IS THE CONTRACTOR ’S RESPONSIBILITY TO REPAIR SUCH 
ITEMS DAMAGED. 
R. FIRE SPRINKLER SYSTEM(S) NOT ASSOCIATED WITH THE DEMOLITION SHALL BE LEFT IN SERVICE 
AS APPLICABLE. 
S. CUTTING AND PATCHING OF ANY EXISTING CONDITIONS INCLUDING FLOORS, WALLS, AND CEILINGS 
REQUIRED FOR THE INSTALLATION OF THE FIRE PROTECTION SYSTEM IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF 
THE GENERAL CONTRACTOR. ALL WORK SHALL BE COORDINATED WITH THE G.C. AND ALL OTHER 
TRADES. 
DEMOLITION GENERAL NOTES 
T. ALL SHUTDOWNS SHALL BE COORDINATED AND APPROVED THROUGH THE OWNER'S 
REPRESENTATIVE AND WILL REQUIRE A MINIMUM OF 10 DAYS ADVANCE NOTICE THIS TIME LENGTH 
MAY BE LONGER OR SHORTER FOR SOME SHUT DOWNS AND SHALL BE AT THE OWNER'S 
DISCRETION. DRAINING AND REFILLING OF THE EXISTING SYSTEM IS A RESPONSIBILITY OF THE 
OWNER'S REPRESENTATIVE. 
U. THE INFORMATION GIVEN HEREIN IS AS EXACT AS COULD BE SECURED FOR BIDDING PURPOSES 
AND ITS ACCURACY IS NOT GUARANTEED. THE AUTOMATIC SPRINKLER CONTRACTOR IS 
RESPONSIBLE FOR EXAMINING BOTH THE EXISTING AND NEW JOB CONDITIONS AND VERIFYING ALL 
MEASUREMENTS, DISTANCES, ELEVATIONS, CLEARANCES, PIPE SIZES, ETC., BEFORE STARTING 
THE DEMOLITION OR NEW WORK. 
V. REUSE OF ANY SPRINKLER HEAD THAT IS REMOVED FROM SERVICE IS NOT ACCEPTABLE; REFER 
TO NFPA 25, SECTION 5.4.1.1.

A. THE PLUMBING CONTRACTOR SHALL VERIFY AND COORDINATE THE 
INSTALLATION OF THE PLUMBING SYSTEMS WITH OTHER TRADES 
PRIOR TO INSTALLATION TO AVOID CONFLICTS ABOVE CEILING AND 
BELOW FLOORS. 
B. THE PLUMBING CONTRACTOR SHALL VERIFY ALL WASTE AND 
WATER REQUIREMENTS AND LOCATIONS FOR CONNECTING 
OWNERS EQUIPMENT PRIOR TO INSTALLATION. PROVIDE ALL 
NECESSARY MATERIALS AND COMPONENTS. VERIFY AND INSTALL 
PER MANUFACTURES WRITTEN SPECIFICATIONS, INSTRUCTIONS, 
AND ALL LOCAL AND NATIONAL CODES. 
C. PLUMBING CONTRACTOR SHALL COORDINATE WITH 
ARCHITECTURAL PLANS ALL FIRE OR SMOKE RATED BARRIERS, 
WALLS, OR PARTITIONS, AND ALL LOCAL NATIONAL CODES.
D. PLUMBING CONTRACTOR SHALL NOT INSTALL SHUT -OFF VALVES 
ABOVE WHERE ANY SHEET ROCK CEILINGS ARE TO BE INSTALLED. 
WHERE VALVES DO OCCUR, A 2 ’X2 ’ ACCESS PANEL SHALL BE 
INSTALLED. ARCHITECT SHALL BE NOTIFIED BEFORE PANEL IS 
INSTALLED. 
E. THE PLUMBING CONTRACTOR SHALL VERIFY AND COORDINATE ALL 
PIPING INVERTS WITH EXISTING CONDITIONS PRIOR TO NEW 
INSTALLATIONS. PLUMBING DOCUMENTS ARE DIAGRAMMATIC AND 
ARE NOT INTENDED TO INCLUDE EVERY ASPECT OF THE REQUIRED 
WORK. PLUMBING CONTRACTOR SHALL ENSURE A COMPLETE AND 
WORKING SYSTEM IS INSTALLED. 
F. FIELD VERIFY EXACT LOCATION AND SIZE OF WASTE, VENT, STORM, 
AND WATER PIPING RISERS PRIOR TO ANY DEMOLITION AND 
RELOCATION. CONTACT ENGINEER ONCE PIPING SYSTEMS HAVE 
BEEN UNCOVERED/EXPOSED. 
G. ALL DRAWINGS ARE DIAGRAMMATIC. CONTRACTOR TO PROVIDE 
COORDINATION DOCUMENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE 
SPECIFICATIONS. ADDITIONAL TRANSITIONS REQUIRED DUE TO 
FIELD CONDITIONS ARE THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE CONTRACTOR. 
GENERAL NOTES 
DEMOLISH EXISTING PLUMBING FIXTURE AND ROUGH -INS COMPLETE. 
EXISTING OXYGEN, MEDICAL VACUUM, AND MEDICAL AIR RISERS TO

A. ALL DUCT, PIPE, AND EQUIPMENT SHALL BE LATERALLY RESTRAINED TO 
COMPLY WITH STATE BUILDING CODE. 
B. BEFORE FABRICATING ANY SHEET METAL DUCTWORK, COORDINATE LOCATION 
AND SIZE WITH SPRINKLER & PLUMBING PIPING, CONDUITS, LIGHT FIXTURES, 
STRUCTURAL, ETC. PLANS ARE SCHEMATIC AND ARE NOT SHOP DRAWINGS. 
SUBMIT DUCTWORK COORDINATION DRAWINGS, AS SPECIFIED. 
C. BEFORE SUBMITTING SHOP DRAWINGS, COORDINATE VOLTAGES AVAILABLE FOR 
MECHANICAL EQUIPMENT AND PROVISION ALL STARTERS AND DISCONNECT 
SWITCHES WITH ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR. 
D. MECHANICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL MAKE PROVISIONS FOR PROVIDING A 
CONDENSATE DRAIN TRAP A MINIMUM OF 4" DEEP OR 1/2" PLUS THE STATIC 
PRESSURE OF THE UNIT SUPPLY FAN. 
E. ALL EQUIPMENT SHALL BE U.L. LISTED. 
F. THE ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL CONNECT ALL MECHANICAL EQUIPMENT; 
PROVIDE DISCONNECTS, WIRING AND CONDUIT, INSTALL STARTERS, AND MOUNT 
AND WIRE VFD, UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED. 
G. FIRE AND SMOKE DAMPERS SHALL BE INSTALLED IN COMPLETE ACCORDANCE 
WITH THE MFR'S. U.L. LISTING AND INSTALLATION INSTRUCTIONS. FIRE AND 
SMOKE DAMPERS SHALL HAVE SPECIFIC U.L. LISTING FOR THE CONSTRUCTION 
IN WHICH THEY ARE INSTALLED. 
H. MECHANICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR COORDINATION WITH 
OTHER TRADES TO ELIMINATE CONFLICT WITH OTHER TRADES. ANY WORK 
INSTALLED BY THIS CONTRACTOR THAT RESULTS IN CONFLICT, DUE TO LACK 
OF COORDINATION BETWEEN TRADES, SHALL BE CHANGED AS DIRECTED BY 
THE ARCHITECT/ENGINEER WITHOUT ADDITIONAL COMPENSATION TO THE 
CONTRACTOR. 
I. SMOKE DETECTORS SHALL BE FURNISHED BY ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR AND 
INSTALLED BY THE MECHANICAL CONTRACTOR. PROVIDE DUCT ACCESS DOOR 
AT EACH DETECTOR. INSTALL DETECTORS IN COMPLETE ACCORDANCE WITH 
THE MANUFACTURER'S INSTRUCTIONS. 
J. COORDINATE HEIGHT OF ROOF CURBS AND ROOF SUPPORTS WITH ROOFING 
CONTRACTOR. 
K. MECHANICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL COORDINATE ROUTING OF DUCTWORK TO 
ENSURE DUCTWORK DOES NOT PASS OVER ELECTRICAL PANELS. 
L. THE DRAWINGS SHALL NOT BE SCALED FOR CONSTRUCTION PURPOSES. THE 
SCALE, WHEN INDICATED IS INTENDED FOR GENERAL REFERENCE ONLY. 
M. ALL SHUTDOWNS SHALL BE COORDINATED AND APPROVED THROUGH THE 
CONTRACTING OFFICERS REPRESENTATIVE AND WILL REQUIRE ADVANCE NOTICE 
OF TWO WEEKS.THIS TIME LENGTH MAY BE LONGER OR SHORTER FOR SOME 
SHUTDOWNS AND SHALL BE AT THE OWNERS DISCRETION. 
N. PROVIDE ESCUTCHEON PLATES WHERE DUCTS PENETRATE CEILINGS OR WALLS 
IN AREAS EXPOSED TO VIEW. ESCUTCHEONS FOR DUCTS SHALL BE 
CONSTRUCTED OF SAME MATERIAL AS DUCT. PIPE ESCUTCHEONS SHALL BE 
CHROME -PLATED BRASS. 
O. PROVIDE REMOVABLE ACCESS DOORS AT ALL MOTOR OPERATED DAMPERS, 
FIRE DAMPERS, SMOKE DAMPERS, DUCT COILS, SMOKE DETECTORS, AND 
SIMILAR ITEMS REQUIRING MAINTENANCE OR ADJUSTMENT. 
P. PROVIDE FIRE CAULKING OR OTHER APPROVED FIRESTOP SYSTEM AT ALL 
MECHANICAL PIPING PENETRATIONS OF RATED ASSEMBLY WITHIN THE LIMITS OF 
CONSTRUCTION (NEW AND EXISTING).

ASSEMBLY & THROUGH PENETRATION MATERIAL ENCOUNTERED. FILL VOIDS OR

UTILIZED.

1. RIGID STRAIGHT TERMINAL UNIT INLET LENGTH SHALL BE A MINIMUM OF 3 TIMES THE 
DIAMETER OF THE INLET. 
2. A FLEXIBLE AIR DUCT CONNECTOR IS NOT MANDATORY FOR INLET TO THIS BOX, BUT 
ALLOWED TO ACCOMMODATE MINOR OFFSETS. MAXIMUM LENGTH 3' -0" [900mm]. 
3. A BRANCH DUCT SERVING AN INDIVIDUAL BOX MAY BE THE SAME SIZE AS THE BOX INLET, 
PROVIDED THE EQUIVALENT LENGTH OF THE BRANCH DUCT, AS SHOWN, DOES NOT 
EXCEED 10 FEET (3 METERS). FOR LONGER LENGTHS, INCREASE THE DUCT SIZE AND 
PROVIDE A DUCT TRANSITION TO MAINTAIN THE DUCT STATIC PRESSURE DROP AT OR 
BELOW 0.2"/100' [1.64Pa/m].

TO DIFFUSER, SHALL NOT EXCEED 5' -0" [1500mm]. USE RIGID ELBOWS FOR CHANGE OF 
DIRECTION GREATER THAN 45 DEGREES. 
5. COMPONENT ARRANGEMENT MAY VARY BY MANUFACTURER. PROVIDE INSULATION W/ 
VAPOR VARRIER FOR CONNECTION DUCT SECTIONS.

VARIABLE AIR VOLUME TERMINAL UNITS (VAV BOXES) 
1. THE CONTROL OF PRESSURE INDEPENDENT VAV BOXES WITH A WATER 
REHEAT COIL AT THE VAV TERMINAL SHALL BE AS FOLLOWS: 
1.1. THE CONTROLLER SHALL MODULATE THE SUPPLY AIR DAMPER AND 
THE REHEAT VALVE IN SEQUENCE AS REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN SPACE 
TEMPERATURE SETPOINT. 
1.2. IN THE CONTROLLER SHALL MODULATE THE SUPPLY AIR DAMPER AND 
THE REHEAT VALVE IN SEQUENCE AS REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN SPACE 
TEMPERATURE SETPOINT. 
1.3. DURING INITIAL T&B UNITS CFM'S SHALL BE SET TO MAINTAIN MINIMUM 
REQUIRED PRESSURE DIFFERENTIAL BETWEEN ADJACENT SPACES. 
1.4. THE SUPPLY AIR DAMPER SHALL BE SET TO MINIMUM WHEN THE ROOM 
TEMPERATURE IS BELOW THE COOLING SETPOINT. THE REHEAT VALVE 
SHALL NOT OPEN UNTIL THE ROOM TEMPERATURE HAS DROPPED 
BELOW THE HEATING SETPOINT. THE ROOM TEMPERATURE SETPOINT 
MAY BE ADJUSTED BY THE OCCUPANT, WITHIN PRESELECTED LIMITS, 
BY CHANGING A SETPOINT ADJUSTMENT ON THE ROOM THERMOSTAT, 
OR A SETPOINT MAY BE SELECTED BY THE DDC SYSTEM OPERATOR 
THAT WILL OVERRIDE AND LIMIT ANY CHANGES MADE AT THE ROOM 
STATUS. 
1.5. THE ROOM TEMPERATURE SENSOR IS LOCATED IN THE SPACE. THE 
SENSOR FEATURES WARMER/COOLER SETPOINT ADJUSTMENT LEVER 
AND A LIQUID BULB THERMOMETER. A DIAGNOSTIC JACK WILL ALLOW 
FOR A PORTABLE TERMINAL INTERFACE. THE PORTABLE TERMINAL 
INTERFACE IS A HAND HELD DEVICE WHICH GIVES THE OPERATOR THE 
CAPABILITY TO EDIT VAV TERMINAL BOX PARAMETERS. 
2. WHEN COMMANDED TO CHANGE OVER TO THE UNOCCUPIED MODE, THE 
CONTROLLER SHALL RAISE THE COOLING SETPOINT AND LOWER THE 
HEATING SETPOINT TO OPERATOR DETERMINED VALUES. DURING 
UNOCCUPIED MODE, THE CONTROLLER SHALL BE RESET TO THE 
OCCUPIED MODE FOR AN OPERATOR DETERMINED TIME PERIOD BY 
DEPRESSING THE LOCAL OVERRIDE SWITCH PROVIDED FOR EACH ROOM 
OR WHEN THE OPERATOR HAS COMMANDED IT. AT THE END OF THE TIME 
PERIOD, THE CONTROLLER SHALL AUTOMATICALLY SWITCH BACK TO 
UNOCCUPIED MODE. 
3. THE CONTROLLER SHALL MONITOR EACH OF THE FOLLOWING 
PARAMETERS OF THE TERMINAL BOX: 
3.1. SUPPLY AIR TEMPERATURE. 
3.2. SUPPLY AIR VOLUME. 
3.3. SUPPLY DAMPER CONTROL. 
3.4. SUPPLY DAMPER POSITION. 
3.5. REHEAT VALVE CONTROL. 
3.6. ROOM TEMPERATURE. 
3.7. ROOM TEMPERATURE COOLING SETPOINT. 
3.8. ROOM TEMPERATURE HEATING SETPOINT. 
3.9. UNOCCUPIED TEMPERATURE DEADBAND. 
3.10. SUPPLY AIR VOLUME MAXIMUM FLOW. 
3.11. SUPPLY AIR VOLUME MINIMUM FLOW. 
3.12. LOCAL OCCUPIED OVERRIDE SWITCH. 
3.13. FAN STATUS. 
4. THE CENTRAL GRAPHICS CONSOLE AND ANY OTHER OPERATOR'S 
CONSOLE SHALL BE CAPABLE OF DISPLAY AND CONTROL OF EACH OF 
THESE PARAMETERS. THE PORTABLE DISPLAY TERMINAL CONNECTED TO 
THE CONTROLLER SHALL ALSO BE ABLE TOMONITOR AND CONTROL 
THESE PARAMETERS. MONITOR AND CONTROL THESE PARAMETERS. 
5. PROVIDE A GRAPHIC FOR EACH ROOM SHOWING FLOOR PLAN, ROOM 
TEMPERATURE AND ROOM SETPOINT. THESE SHALL BE ARRANGED SO 
THAT THE OPERATOR SHALL "CLICK ON THE ROOM" AND A WINDOW SHALL 
APPEAR ALLOWING ANY OF THE PARAMETERS AVAILABLE ON THE 
CONTROLLER TO BE SELECTED AND MODIFIED BY THE POINTING OF A 
MOUSE. THESE ROOM GRAPHICS SHALL BE GROUPED TOGETHER IN 
FLOOR QUADRANTS. THE ROOM'S COLOR SHALL INDICATE GREEN IF THE 
ROOM TEMPERATURE IS WITHIN ALARM RANGE AND IT SHALL INDICATE 
RED IF THE ROOM TEMPERATURE IS ABOVE OR BELOW ALARM RANGE. 
THE QUADRANT GRAPHIC SHALL CONTAIN A SMALL LAYOUT OF THE TOTAL 
FLOOR AND SHALL SHOW THE PRESENTLY DISPLAYED GRAPHIC'S 
REACTION TO THE REST OF THE FLOOR. ALSO LOCATED ON THE 
QUADRANT GRAPHIC SHALL BE "QUICK LINKS" TO THE QUADRANTS OF THIS 
AND OTHER FLOORS. 
6. AUTOMATIC CALIBRATION IS ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH THE CONTROLLER 
AUTO ZERO FEATURE. THIS FEATURE CALIBRATES THE AIRFLOW SENSOR. 
THE AUTO ZERO FEATURE CAN BE COMMANDED FROM THE BMS OR CAN 
BE SCHEDULED. THIS FEATURE OVERRIDES THE DAMPER ACTUATOR 
CLOSED WHILE PERFORMING AUTO ZERO. WHEN THE DAMPER IS FULLY 
CLOSED, THE PRESENT VALUE OF DELTA P SENSOR IS READ INTO THE AI 
OFFSET TABLE. 
CONSTANT AIR VOLUME TERMINAL AIR UNITS (CAV BOXES) 
1. CAV BOX CONTROLS SHALL BE PROVIDED TO MEET THE CONTROL 
SPECIFICATIONS FOR VAV BOXES, BUT SHALL OPERATE WITH THE 
FOLLOWING CONTROL SEQUENCE: 
1.1. THE CAV BOX AIRFLOW SHALL BE CONSTANT 
1.2. UPON A FALL IN ROOM TEMPERATURE BELOW THE SETPOINT, THE HOT 
WATER CONTROL VALVE SHALL BE MODULATED TO THE OPEN 
POSITION. 
1.3. UPON A RISE IN ROOM TEMPERATURE ABOVE THE SETPOINT, THE HOT 
WATER CONTROL VALVE SHALL BE MODULATED TO THE CLOSED 
POSITION. 
2. T&B CONTRACTOR SHALL BE ABLE TO ADJUST (SET) EACH OF CAV BOXES 
CFM'S AT INITIAL PROCEDURE TO ACHIEVE REQUIRED DIFFERENTIAL 
PRESSURES BETWEEN SPACES. 
SMOKE CONTROL SEQUENCE 
1. THE FIRE ALARM CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE NECESSARY LOCAL 
CONTACT CLOSURES AT DDC PANEL FOR REQUIRED CONTROL SEQUENCE. 
2. UPON DETECTION OF SMOKE BY ANY OF THE SMOKE DETECTORS, AN 
ALARM SIGNAL SHALL BE SENT TO EXISTING MAIN FIRE ALARM PANEL. 
3. SHUTDOWN SEQUENCE SHALL INCLUDE IN ADDITION TO EXISTING AHU 
SEQUENCE, CLOSURE OF FIRE/SMOKE DAMPERS IN CORRESPONDING 
SMOKE ZONE'S ON THIS FLOOR.

A. ALL DUCTS, PIPE, AND EQUIPMENT SHALL BE LATERALLY RESTRAINED 
TO COMPLY WITH THE STATE BUILDING CODE. 
B. BEFORE FABRICATING ANY SHEET METAL DUCTWORK, COORDINATE 
LOCATION AND SIZE WITH SPRINKLER & PLUMBING PIPING, CONDUITS, 
LIGHT FIXTURES, STRUCTURAL, ETC.  PLANS ARE SCHEMATIC AND ARE 
NOT SHOP DRAWINGS.  SUBMIT DUCTWORK COORDINATION 
DRAWINGS, AS SPECIFIED. 
C. BEFORE SUBMITTING SHOP DRAWINGS, COORDINATE VOLTAGES 
AVAILABLE FOR MECHANICAL EQUIPMENT AND PROVISION OF ALL 
STARTERS AND DISCONNECT SWITCHES WITH ELECTRICAL 
CONTRACTOR. 
D. MECHANICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL MAKE PROVISIONS FOR PROVIDING 
A CONDENSATE DRAIN TRAP A MINIMUM OF 4" DEEP OR 1/2" PLUS THE 
STATIC PRESSURE OF THE UNIT SUPPLY FAN. 
E. ALL EQUIPMENT SHALL BE U.L. LISTED. 
F. THE ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL CONNECT ALL MECHANICAL 
EQUIPMENT; PROVIDE DISCONNECTS, WIRING AND CONDUIT, INSTALL 
STARTERS, AND MOUNT AND WIRE VARIABLE SPEED DRIVES, UNLESS 
OTHERWISE NOTED. 
G. FIRE AND SMOKE DAMPERS SHALL BE INSTALLED IN COMPLETE 
ACCORDANCE WITH THE MANUFACTURER'S U.L. LISTING AND 
INSTALLATION INSTRUCTIONS.  FIRE AND SMOKE DAMPERS SHALL 
HAVE SPECIFIC U.L. LISTING FOR THE CONSTRUCTION IN WHICH THEY 
ARE INSTALLED.  PROVIDE DYNAMIC FIRE DAMPERS. 
H. MECHANICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR 
COORDINATION WITH OTHER TRADES TO ELIMINATE CONFLICT WITH 
OTHER TRADES. ANY WORK INSTALLED BY THIS CONTRACTOR THAT 
RESULTS IN CONFLICT, DUE TO LACK OF COORDINATION BETWEEN 
TRADES, SHALL BE CHANGED AS DIRECTED BY THE 
ARCHITECT/ENGINEER WITHOUT ADDITIONAL COMPENSATION TO THE 
CONTRACTOR. 
I. SMOKE DETECTORS SHALL BE FURNISHED BY THE FIRE ALARM 
CONTRACTOR AND INSTALLED BY THE MECHANICAL CONTRACTOR 
UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED.  PROVIDE DUCT ACCESS DOOR AT EACH 
DETECTOR.  INSTALL DETECTORS IN COMPLETE ACCORDANCE WITH 
THE MANUFACTURER'S INSTRUCTIONS. 
GENERAL NOTES 
J. MECHANICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL COORDINATE ROUTING OF 
DUCTWORK TO ENSURE DUCTWORK DOES NOT PASS OVER 
ELECTRICAL PANELS. 
K. THE DRAWINGS SHALL NOT BE SCALED FOR CONSTRUCTION 
PURPOSES. THE SCALE, WHEN INDICATED IS INTENDED FOR GENERAL 
REFERENCE ONLY. 
L. ALL SHUTDOWNS SHALL BE COORDINATED AND APPROVED THROUGH 
THE OWNERS REPRESENTATIVE AND WILL REQUIRE ADVANCE NOTICE 
OF ONE WEEK.  THIS TIME LENGTH MAY BE LONGER OR SHORTER FOR 
SOME SHUTDOWNS AND SHALL BE AT THE OWNERS DISCRETION. 
M. LEAVE A MINIMUM CLEARANCE OF 2 INCHES ABOVE DUCTS INSTALLED 
IN RATED PARTITIONS TO ALLOW SPACE FOR THE GENERAL 
CONTRACTOR TO SEAL THE WALL ABOVE THE DUCTS.  DO NOT INSTALL 
FLEXIBLE DUCT THROUGH RATED WALLS, BARRIERS OR PARTITIONS. 
N. PROVIDE REMOVABLE ACCESS DOORS AT ALL MOTOR OPERATED 
DAMPERS, FIRE DAMPERS, SMOKE DAMPERS, DUCT COILS, SMOKE 
DETECTORS, AND SIMILAR ITEMS REQUIRING MAINTENANCE OR 
ADJUSTMENT. 
O. MECHANICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL INSTALL MANUAL VOLUME DAMPERS 
ON ALL BRANCH DUCTWORK CONNECTIONS. 
P. CONSTRUCTION DEBRIS SHALL BE REMOVED DAILY. 
DEMOLISH EXISTING INDUCTION UNIT AND ALL ASSOCIATED SUPPORTS 
AND CONTROLS COMPLETE. DEMOLISH ASSOCIATED DUCTWORK BACK TO

REMOVE ALL ASSOCIATED PIPING INCLUDING CONDENSATE DRAINS, IF

THE DEMOLITION PLAN IS INTENEDED TO PROVIDE THE CONTRACTOR 
WITH A GENERAL KNOWLEDGE OF THE EXISTING CONDITIONS WITHIN THE 
PROJECT AREA. EXISTING EQUIPMENT, STRUCTURE, DUCTWORK, ETC. 
LOCATED ON THE DRAWINGS WERE DERIVED FROM EXISTING DRAWINGS 
AND LIMITED SITE OBSERVATIONS. THIS DRAWING MAY NOT BE ALL 
INCLUSIVE OF SERVICES THAT EXIST IN THE PROJECT AREA. CONTRACTOR 
SHALL VERIFY EXISTING CONDITIONS PRIOR TO BID AND DEMOLITION 
WORK. FIELD CONDTIONS SHALL GOVERN. ANY DEVIATIONS IMPACTING 
WORK SHOWN ON THESE DOCUMENTS SHALL BE REPORTED TO THE 
ARCHITECT AND ENGINEER PRIOR TO BEGINNING DEMOLITION. BEGINNING 
OF DEMOLITION SHALL SIGNIFY CONTRACTORS ACCEPTANCE OF EXISTING

A. ALL DUCTS, PIPE, AND EQUIPMENT SHALL BE LATERALLY RESTRAINED 
TO COMPLY WITH THE STATE BUILDING CODE. 
B. BEFORE FABRICATING ANY SHEET METAL DUCTWORK, COORDINATE 
LOCATION AND SIZE WITH SPRINKLER & PLUMBING PIPING, CONDUITS, 
LIGHT FIXTURES, STRUCTURAL, ETC.  PLANS ARE SCHEMATIC AND ARE 
NOT SHOP DRAWINGS.  SUBMIT DUCTWORK COORDINATION 
DRAWINGS, AS SPECIFIED. 
C. BEFORE SUBMITTING SHOP DRAWINGS, COORDINATE VOLTAGES 
AVAILABLE FOR MECHANICAL EQUIPMENT AND PROVISION OF ALL 
STARTERS AND DISCONNECT SWITCHES WITH ELECTRICAL 
CONTRACTOR. 
D. MECHANICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL MAKE PROVISIONS FOR PROVIDING 
A CONDENSATE DRAIN TRAP A MINIMUM OF 4" DEEP OR 1/2" PLUS THE 
STATIC PRESSURE OF THE UNIT SUPPLY FAN. 
E. ALL EQUIPMENT SHALL BE U.L. LISTED. 
F. THE ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL CONNECT ALL MECHANICAL 
EQUIPMENT; PROVIDE DISCONNECTS, WIRING AND CONDUIT, INSTALL 
STARTERS, AND MOUNT AND WIRE VARIABLE SPEED DRIVES, UNLESS 
OTHERWISE NOTED. 
G. FIRE AND SMOKE DAMPERS SHALL BE INSTALLED IN COMPLETE 
ACCORDANCE WITH THE MANUFACTURER'S U.L. LISTING AND 
INSTALLATION INSTRUCTIONS.  FIRE AND SMOKE DAMPERS SHALL 
HAVE SPECIFIC U.L. LISTING FOR THE CONSTRUCTION IN WHICH THEY 
ARE INSTALLED.  PROVIDE DYNAMIC FIRE DAMPERS. 
H. MECHANICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR 
COORDINATION WITH OTHER TRADES TO ELIMINATE CONFLICT WITH 
OTHER TRADES. ANY WORK INSTALLED BY THIS CONTRACTOR THAT 
RESULTS IN CONFLICT, DUE TO LACK OF COORDINATION BETWEEN 
TRADES, SHALL BE CHANGED AS DIRECTED BY THE 
ARCHITECT/ENGINEER WITHOUT ADDITIONAL COMPENSATION TO THE 
CONTRACTOR. 
I. SMOKE DETECTORS SHALL BE FURNISHED BY THE FIRE ALARM 
CONTRACTOR AND INSTALLED BY THE MECHANICAL CONTRACTOR 
UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED.  PROVIDE DUCT ACCESS DOOR AT EACH 
DETECTOR.  INSTALL DETECTORS IN COMPLETE ACCORDANCE WITH 
THE MANUFACTURER'S INSTRUCTIONS. 
GENERAL NOTES 
J. MECHANICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL COORDINATE ROUTING OF 
DUCTWORK TO ENSURE DUCTWORK DOES NOT PASS OVER 
ELECTRICAL PANELS. 
K. THE DRAWINGS SHALL NOT BE SCALED FOR CONSTRUCTION 
PURPOSES. THE SCALE, WHEN INDICATED IS INTENDED FOR GENERAL 
REFERENCE ONLY. 
L. ALL SHUTDOWNS SHALL BE COORDINATED AND APPROVED THROUGH 
THE OWNERS REPRESENTATIVE AND WILL REQUIRE ADVANCE NOTICE 
OF ONE WEEK.  THIS TIME LENGTH MAY BE LONGER OR SHORTER FOR 
SOME SHUTDOWNS AND SHALL BE AT THE OWNERS DISCRETION. 
M. LEAVE A MINIMUM CLEARANCE OF 2 INCHES ABOVE DUCTS INSTALLED 
IN RATED PARTITIONS TO ALLOW SPACE FOR THE GENERAL 
CONTRACTOR TO SEAL THE WALL ABOVE THE DUCTS.  DO NOT INSTALL 
FLEXIBLE DUCT THROUGH RATED WALLS, BARRIERS OR PARTITIONS. 
N. PROVIDE REMOVABLE ACCESS DOORS AT ALL MOTOR OPERATED 
DAMPERS, FIRE DAMPERS, SMOKE DAMPERS, DUCT COILS, SMOKE 
DETECTORS, AND SIMILAR ITEMS REQUIRING MAINTENANCE OR 
ADJUSTMENT. 
O. MECHANICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL INSTALL MANUAL VOLUME DAMPERS 
ON ALL BRANCH DUCTWORK CONNECTIONS. 
P. CONSTRUCTION DEBRIS SHALL BE REMOVED DAILY.

A. THE DRAWINGS SHALL NOT BE SCALED FOR CONSTRUCTION PURPOSES. THE SCALE, WHEN 
INDICATED, IS INTENDED FOR REFERENCE PURPOSES  ONLY. 
B. ALL POWER OUTAGES SHALL BE COORDINATED AND APPROVED THROUGH THE OWNERS' 
REPRESENTATIVE AND REQUIRE ADVANCE NOTICE OF AT LEAST TWO (2) WEEKS. AT THE 
OWNER'S REPRESENTATIVE ’S DISCRETION, THIS TIME LENGTH MAY BE INCREASED OR 
DECREASED, DEPENDING ON THE SYSTEMS IMPACTED BY THE POWER OUTAGE. 
C. CONSTRUCTION DEBRIS SHALL BE REMOVED DAILY, OR AT THE OWNER'S REPRESENTATIVE ’S 
DISCRETION. 
D. ALL ELECTRICAL MATERIAL, DEVICES, APPLIANCES, AND FIXED EQUIPMENT PROVIDED SHALL 
BE LISTED AND LABELED BY A NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED AND STATE APPROVED THIRD PARTY 
TESTING AGENCY. FACTORY LISTED COMPONENTS ASSEMBLED TOGETHER SHALL BE 
REVIEWED AND LABELED AS AN ASSEMBLY BY THE STATE APPROVED TESTING AGENCY. 
E. FIRE ALARM APPLIANCES AND DEVICES SHOWN IN AN AREA INDICATE TO PROVIDE COVERAGE 
IN THAT AREA. ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE APPLIANCES AND DEVICES AS 
REQUIRED BY THE LATEST EDITION OF NFPA 72 AND THE BUILDING CODE. NO CHANGE ORDERS 
WILL BE ALLOWED FOR APPLIANCES AND DEVICES REQUIRED BY NFPA 72 AND THE BUILDING 
CODE. 
F. CONTRACTOR SHALL COORDINATE WITH THE FACILITY'S INFECTION CONTROL OFFICER TO 
VERIFY THAT APPROPRIATE SAFEGUARDS ARE BEING TAKEN TO PROTECT WORKERS 
INVOLVED IN DEMOLITION ACTIVITIES. 
G. CONTRACTOR SHALL COORDINATE WITH THE FACILITY'S INFECTION CONTROL OFFICER TO 
VERIFY THAT APPROPRIATE PRECAUTIONS ARE BEING TAKEN TO PROTECT FACILITY STAFF 
AND PATIENTS DURING THE CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES. 
H. ASBESTOS CONTAINING MATERIALS (IF PRESENT) WILL BE IDENTIFIED BY THE OWNER AND 
WILL BE REMOVED FROM AHU'S, PIPING INSULATION, DUCT INSULATION, ETC. (IF REQUIRED) 
PRIOR TO CONTRACTOR BEGINNING ANY WORK ON THE SITE. COORDINATE WITH THE OWNER. 
I. ELECTRICAL WORK SHALL BE COMPLETED ACCORDING TO THE TRUE INTENT AND MEANING AS 
INDICATED IN THE CONTRACT DOCUMENTS. ANYTHING NOT ENTIRELY CLEAR SHALL BE 
EXPLAINED IF SUBMITTED TO THE ARCHITECT/ENGINEER IN WRITING. 
J. CONNECTIONS OF FEEDERS AND BRANCH CIRCUITS TO SWITCHBOARDS/PANELBOARDS SHALL 
BE DONE IN A MANNER AS TO LIMIT THE OUTAGES TO AN ABSOLUTE MINIMUM. 
K. ALL TERMINATIONS, CONDUCTORS, AND DEVICES SHALL BE 75 DEGREE CELCIUS RATED, TO 
THE EXTENT FEASIBLE; OTHERWISE COMPLY WITH NEC ARTICLE 110.14(C)(1). 
L. ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL NOT ROUTE WIRING CONNECTED TO THE LIFE SAFETY 
BRANCH OR THE CRITICAL BRANCH IN FLEXIBLE METAL RACEWAYS OR METAL SHEATHED 
CABLE ASSEMBLIES, EXCEPT AS ALLOWED BY NEC ARTICLE 517.31(C)(3)(3). 
M. ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE RACEWAYS, JUNCTION BOXES, CABINETS, ETC., IN 
ORDER TO SEPARATE THE LIFE SAFETY BRANCH AND/OR THE CRITICAL BRANCH CIRCUIT 
WIRING FROM THE WIRING AND EQUIPMENT SERVED BY ANY OTHER BRANCHES OF POWER. 
N. UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED FOR MEDICAL EQUIPMENT, ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL 
INSTALL ALL RACEWAY, BOXES, AND CABLES. THE CABLES, UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED, SHALL 
BE PROVIDED BY THE MEDICAL EQUIPMENT VENDOR. 
O. ELECTRICAL WORK SHALL BE COMPLETED ACCORDING TO THE PHASES SHOWN ON THE 
ARCHITECTURAL PLANS OR AS ESTABLISHED IN THE "GENERAL CONDITIONS". 
P. THE EQUIPMENT GROUNDING TERMINAL BUSES OF THE NORMAL AND THE ESSENTIAL 
ELECTRICAL SYSTEM BRANCH -CIRCUIT PANELBOARDS, SERVING THE SAME INDIVIDUAL 
PATIENT CARE VICINITY, SHALL BE BONDED TOGETHER WITH A CONTINUOUS, INSULATED 
COPPER GROUNDING CONDUCTOR NOT SMALLER THAN 10 AWG.
Q. A MAXIMUM OF THREE (3) 20 AMPERE, 1 POLE BRANCH CIRCUITS MAY BE COMBINED IN A 
COMMON HOMERUN SHARING A COMMON GROUNDED (NEUTRAL) OR WITH DEDICATED 
SEPARATE NEUTRALS (GROUNDED CONDUCTORS), FOR A TOTAL OF SIX CURRENT CARRYING 
CONDUCTORS. ALL BRANCH CIRCUITS LARGER THAN 20A SHALL BE SEPARATELY HOMERUN TO 
THE PANELBOARD. 
R. ALL CONDUCTORS SHALL BE COPPER, RATED AT NOT LESS THAN 600 VOLTS. MINIMUM SIZE 
SHALL BE NO. 12 AWG, UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED ON THE DRAWINGS. ALL CONDUCTORS #8 
AWG AND LARGER SHALL BE STRANDED. #10 THRU #12 AWG CONDUCTORS SHALL BE SOLID. 
ALL INSULATION TYPES SHALL BE THWN OR THHN, UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED. 
S. ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL USE MULTI -POLE CIRCUIT BREAKERS FOR ALL BRANCH 
CIRCUITS WITH SHARED NEUTRALS (GROUNDED CONDUCTORS) PER NEC ARTICLE 210.4(B) OR 
PROVIDE SEPARATE NEUTRALS (GROUNDED CONDUCTORS) FOR EACH BRANCH CIRCUIT. 
PANELBOARD SCHEDULES SHALL INDICATE IF MULTI -POLE OR SINGLE -POLE CIRCUIT 
BREAKERS WERE USED. 
T. ALL WORK ASSOCIATED WITH VOICE, DATA, CCTV, CATV, NURSE CALL, WI -FI, PUBLIC ADDRESS, 
SECURITY ACCESS, TO BE PROVIDED BY THE OWNER. THE ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL 
PROVIDE BACK BOXES AND CONDUIT STUBBED -UP, TO ACCESSIBLE CORRIDOR CEILING SPACE, 
WITH PULL WIRE. 
U. ALL 20 AMPERE SINGLE PHASE BRANCH CIRCUIT WIRING, TO PREVENT A VOLTAGE  DROP 
EXCEEDING 3%, SHALL BE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FOLLOWING TABLE: 
                                                                                                                      
                                                                                                                           
V. A SHORT -CIRCUIT/ARC FLASH AND SELECTIVE COORDINATION STUDY SHALL BE PREPARED 
FOR THE ELECTRICAL OVERCURRENT DEVICES BEING INSTALLED FOR THIS PROJECT. FINAL 
FIELD SETTINGS AND MODIFICATIONS OF THE OVERCURRENT PROTECTIVE DEVICES SHALL BE 
MADE TO CONFIRM WITH THE STUDY, WITHOUT ADDITIONAL COST OR TIME TO THE OWNER. 
W. ALL BREAKERS 600 AMPERES AND ABOVE SHALL BE SOLID -STATE TYPE. SELECT ELECTRONIC 
TRIP FUNCTIONS FOR LOW -VOLTAGE CIRCUIT BREAKERS SO AS TO ACHIEVE SELECTIVE 
COORDINATION AS REQUIRED BY NFPA 70 (NEC). 
X. LIGHTING LAYOUTS ARE BASED ON LIGHTING LEVELS RECOMMENDED BY THE IESNA 
(ILLUMINATING ENGINEERING SOCIETY OF NORTH AMERICA). LIGHT LEVELS ARE AFFECTED BY 
ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS SUCH AS THE COLOR OF FINISHES (CEILINGS, WALLS, FLOORS, 
ETC.), WINDOW TREATMENTS, FURNISHINGS, AND FINAL LUMINAIRE SELECTIONS. ALL 
ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS MAY NOT BE ESTABLISHED DURING DESIGN, WHICH MAY IMPACT 
THE LIGHTING LEVELS UPON THE COMPLETION OF CONSTRUCTION. BASIS OF DESIGN LIGHTING 
CALCULATIONS FOR SPECIFIC AREAS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

Y. ALL DEMOLITION WORK SHALL BE COORDINATED WITH THE OWNER PRIOR TO BEGINNING 
THE WORK. 
Z. ALL ELECTRICAL DEVICES, LUMINAIRES, WIRING, AND RACEWAYS IN WALLS AND IN 
CEILINGS BEING DEMOLISHED SHALL BE REMOVED, UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED. 
RECONNECT EXISTING DEVICES AND LUMINIRES DOWNSTREAM OF THOSE BEING 
REMOVED. WIRING AND RACEWAYS SHALL BE REMOVED BACK TO THEIR SOURCE OF 
POWER, UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED. 
AA. EXISTING ELECTRICAL WORK SHOWN TO REMAIN, BUT INTERFERES WITH THE NEW WORK, 
SHALL BE REWORKED AND RELOCATED TO AVOID ANY INTERFERENCE. 
BB. ELECTRICAL DEMOLITION WORK SHALL BE PHASED. THE ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL 
DEVELOP A PHASING PLAN THAT WILL WORK WITH THE ARCHITECT ’S OVERALL PHASING 
PLAN, THE WORK TO BE PERFORMED BY OTHER TRADES, AND TO MAINTAIN THE OWNER ’S 
OPERATIONS. 
CC. ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE TEMPORARY POWER TO MAINTAIN THE 
OWNER ’S OPERATIONS, AT NO EXTRA COST OR TIME TO THE OWNER, IN ORDER TO KEEP 
THE BUILDING IN OPERATION DURING EACH PHASE OF THE PROJECT. 
DD. REMOVE EXISTING ELECTRICAL GEAR AS SHOWN. DEMOLITION OF FEEDERS AND BRANCH 
CIRCUITS OR TRANSFERRING FEEDERS AND BRANCH CIRCUITS TO NEW PANELBOARDS, 
SHALL BE PERFORMED IN A MANNER AS TO KEEP DOWNTIME AND OUTAGES TO AN 
ABSOLUTE MINIMUM. 
EE. ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL PREPARE AN OUTAGE PLAN, INCLUDING PROVISIONS 
FOR TEMPORARY POWER, AND SUBMIT IT WITH THEIR BID. THE OUTAGE PLAN SHALL 
INCLUDE ALL OUTAGES REQUIRED TO PERFORM THE WORK SHOWN IN THE CONTRACT 
DOCUMENTS. NO EXTRA COST OR TIME TO THE OWNER SHALL BE CONSIDERED FOR NOT 
INCLUDING REQUIRED OUTAGES. ALL OUTAGES SHALL BE COORDINATED WITH, AND 
APPROVED BY, THE OWNER AT LEAST TWO (2) WEEKS IN ADVANCE. AT THE OWNER ’S 
DISCRETION, THIS TIME MAY BE LONGER OR SHORTER FOR SOME SHUTDOWNS. 
FF. ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL REMOVE ALL ELECTRICAL ITEMS ASSOCIATED WITH 
DEMOLITION WORK SHOWN ON THE ARCHITECTURAL, CIVIL, STRUCTURAL, INTERIOR, 
PLUMBING, MECHANICAL, AND FIRE PROTECTION DRAWINGS.
GG. EXISTING ELECTRICAL CONDITIONS ARE BASED UPON SITE SURVEY INFORMATION AND 
EXISTING RECORD/AS -BUILT DRAWINGS MADE AVAILABLE FROM THE OWNER. ELECTRICAL 
WORK SHOWN CONVEYS THE GENERAL SCOPE OF THE DEMOLITION WORK TO BE 
PERFORMED. THE ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL VISIT THE SITE AND OBSERVE THE 
EXISTING CONDITIONS PRIOR TO BIDDING. NO CHANGE ORDERS WILL BE CONSIDERED FOR 
CONDITIONS EASILY VISIBLE DURING A SITE VISIT.

1. THIS IS A STANDARD LEGEND SHEET. NOT ALL SYMBOLS OR ABBREVIATIONS 
MAY APPEAR ON DRAWINGS. 
2. REFER TO DIVISIONS 26, 27 AND 28 SPECIFICATIONS FOR
TELECOMMUNICATION SYSTEM ITEMS. 
3. MOUNTING DEVICES AND EQUIPMENT PER SPECIFICATIONS UNLESS 
OTHERWISE NOTED. 
4. MOUNTING HEIGHTS, UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED, ARE TO CENTER LINE OF 
DEVICE. 
5. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL DETERMINE THE EXACT ROUTING OF RACEWAYS. 
6. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL COORDINATE ALL RACEWAY PENETRATIONS AND 
PROVIDE FIREPROOFING AS APPLICABLE. 
7. THE MAXIMUM PERMANENT HORIZONTAL LINK DISTANCE SHALL BE 295' AND 
THE MAXIMUM HORIZONTAL CHANNEL (LINK PLUS WORKSTATION CABLES AND 
PATCH CORDS) SHALL BE 328'. 
8. ALL HORIZONTAL VOICE AND DATA CABLING SHALL BE CAT 6A INSTALLED IN A 
MINIMUM 1" CONDUIT UNLESS NOTED OTHERWISE FROM TELECOMM OUTLET 
LOCATIONS TO THE CABLE TRAY. 
9. ALL HORIZONTAL AND BACKBONE CABLING SHALL BE PLENUM RATED WITH 
THE EXCEPTION OF CABLING INSTALLED IN UNDERGROUND CONDUITS. SEE 
NOTE 23 FOR CABLES INSTALLED IN UNDERGROUND CONDUITS. 
10. CAT 6A CABLING SHALL BE TERMINATED ON 8 -PIN, 8 -CONDUCTOR (RJ -45) 
CONNECTORS USING PIN/PAIR ASSIGNMENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH T568B 
PIN -OUT SEQUENCE. 
11. CAT 6A JACKS SHALL BE THE SAME COLOR AS CORRESPONDING HORIZONTAL 
VOICE AND DATA CABLING. CAT 6A JACKS SHALL BE THE SAME 
MANUFACTURER AS THE PATCH PANELS. 
12. PROVIDE CAT 6A, 8 -PIN, 8 -CONDUCTOR MODULAR TO 8 -PIN, 8 -CONDUCTOR 
MODULAR, PATCH CABLES IN QUANTITIES AND LENGTHS SUCH THAT ALL 
WORKSTATION CABLES ARE CONNECTED. 
13. PROVIDE CAT 6A, 8 -PIN, 8 -CONDUCTOR MODULAR TO 1 -PAIR 110 CLIP, PATCH 
CABLES IN QUANTITIES AND LENGTHS FOR CONNECTION FROM VOICE PATCH 
PANELS TO RACK MOUNTED 110 BLOCKS. 
14. OPTICAL FIBER CABLES SHALL BE TERMINATED WITH DUPLEX SC -TYPE 
CONNECTORS. 
15. THE USE OF J -HOOKS SHALL BE LIMITED. WHEN USED, J -HOOKS SHALL BE 
CAT 6A RATED AND SPACES AT INTERVALS NOT TO EXCEED 5'. J -HOOKS SHALL 
NOT EXCEED 24 CABLES OR 50% FILL, WHICHEVER IS LESS. WHEN J -HOOKS 
ARE USED TO SPAN FROM CONDUIT STUB UPS TO CABLE TRAY A BONDING 
BUSHING SHALL BE INSTALLED ON THE CONDUIT STUB UPS AND A MINIMUM # 
6 AWG. GROUND CONDUCTOR SHALL BE INSTALLED FROM THE BONDING 
BUSHING TO THE CABLE TRAY, EFFECTIVELY BONDING THE METALLIC 
RACEWAYS TOGETHER. 
16. ALL TELECOMMUNICATIONS RACKS AND SUPPORTING STRUCTURES (CABLE 
TRAYS, LADDER RACKS, CONDUITS, AND BASKETS) WITHIN A TR MUST BE 
BONDED TO THE TR SIGNAL GROUND RING OR BUS BAR (TGB OR TMGB) AS 
DEFINED IN ANSI/TIA -569 -C AND IN ANSI/TIA -607 -B. 
17. CABLE TRAY SHALL BE WALL MOUNTED (PREFERABLE) OR TRAPEZE 
MOUNTED. CENTER HUNG CABLE TRAY IS NOT ALLOWED. CABLE TRAY SHALL 
NOT BE USED TO SUPPORT OTHER ITEMS, CONDUIT, CABLE TRAY, PIPING OF 
UTILITIES. CABLE TRAY SUPPORTS SHALL BE PER NEMA STANDARDS 
PUBLICATION VE 2 - METAL CABLE TRAY INSTALLATION GUIDELINES. 
18. PROVIDE ACCESS PANELS IN NON LAY -IN CEILINGS SUCH THAT NO POINT IN 
THE CABLE TRAY SYSTEM IS MORE THAN 20' FROM AN ACCESS POINT. 
19. PROVIDE A MINIMUM OF 12" OF CLEARANCE ABOVE THE TOP OF CABLE 
TRAYS AND A MINIMUM OF 3" CLEARANCE BELOW CABLE TRAYS. 
20. PROVIDE RECTANGULAR, MODULAR, FIRE RATED WALL PENETRATION 
ASSEMBLIES USING EITHER INTEGRAL, SLIDING COVERS OR REMOVABLE 
PLUGS. 
21. COMPLY WITH ANSI/TIA -569 -C TELECOMMUNICATION PATHWAYS AND SPACES. 
22. USE ONLY COPPER CONDUCTORS FOR GROUND CONNECTIONS. THE USE OF 
ALUMINUM CONDUCTORS IS NOT ALLOWED. 
23. PROVIDE CABLE INSTALLED IN UNDERGROUND CONDUITS LISTED FOR USE IN 
WET LOCATIONS. PLENUM RATED CABLE SHALL NOT BE INSTALLED IN ANY 
UNDERGROUND CONDUIT. 
24. PROVIDE OSP CABLES RATED FOR OUTDOOR USE, FILLED WITH A WATER 
BLOCKING COMPOUND. 
25. LABEL ALL CABLE TERMINATIONS AND BOTH ENDS OF ALL CABLES IN 
ACCORDANCE WITH UFC 3 -580 -01 AND ANSI/TIA -606 -B. 
26. PROVIDE AS -BUILT DOCUMENTATION INCLUDING COMPLETE TEST RESULT 
REPORTS, FLOOR PLANS SHOWING USER WORKSTATIONS WITH CABLING 
LABELING, AND BACKBONE CABLE SCHEMATIC AND LABELING IN AN 
ELECTRONIC FORMAT (PDF) OR OTHER APPROVED FORMAT AND A PRINTED 
HARDCOPY. TEST RESULTS SHALL BE SUPPLIED ELECTRONICALLY TO THE 
PROJECT RCDD AND CORPS PROJECT ENGINEER/ARCHITECT IN THE TEST 
PROGRAM NATIVE FORMAT. 
27. ANY MOTOR, TRANSFORMER, OR OTHER ELECTRICAL DEVICE GREATER THAN 
5 KVA SHALL HAVE A MINIMUM OF A 4' BUFFER FROM ANY WALL OF THE EF, 
TER, OR TR(S). 
28. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL INITIATE THE APPLICATION FOR TELEPHONE 
SERVICE AND ASSIST THE GOVERNMENT IN COMPLETING THE APPLICATION 
FOR SERVICE; ACCEPTING INSTALLATION OF SERVICE; START -UP OF 
SERVICE; AND ACTIVATION OF SPECIFIC TELEPHONE NUMBERS AND 
DEDICATED (POTS) LINES FOR FIRE ALARM, ENTRY CONTROL AND ELEVATOR 
PANELS. 
TERMINATIONS SHALL BE PERFORMED USING PIN/PAIR ASSIGNMENTS IN 
ACCORDANCE WITH THE T568B PIN -OUT SEQUENCE USING 8 -PIN 8 
CONDUCTOR (8P8C) RJ45 TYPE CONNECTORS RATED FOR THE CATEGORY OF 
THE INSTALLED CABLE; COLOR SHALL MATCH THE U/UTP OUTER JACKET.

GENERAL SHEET NOTES 
A. PURPOSES. THE SCALE, WHEN INDICATED, IS INTENDED FOR  
REFERENCE PURPOSES ONLY. 
B. ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL REMOVE ALL ELECTRICAL ITEMS 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE WORK INDICATED TO BE REMOVED ON THE 
ARCHITECTURAL, PLUMBING, MECHANICAL AND FIRE PROTECTION 
DRAWINGS. 
C. ELECTRICAL WORK SHOWN IS BASED ON FIELD OBSERVATIONS AND 
EXISTING DRAWINGS AND IS PROVIDED TO CONVEY THE GENERAL 
SCOPE OF DEMOLITION WORK TO BE ACCOMPLISHED. THE 
ELECTRICAL CONTRACTOR SHALL VISIT THE SITE AND OBSERVE 
EXISTING CONDITIONS PRIOR TO BIDDING. 
ALL PANELBOARDS AND DISCONNECTS HOUSED ON LEVEL 06 
SHALL BE DEMOLISHED. PANELBOARD FEEDERS ARE EXISTING TO 
REMAIN. 
ALL ELECTRICAL DEVICES AND BRANCH CIRCUITS SUPPLYING THE 
DEVICES ON  LEVEL 06 SHALL BE DEMOLISHED. REMOVE DEVICES 
AND DEMOLISH WIRE AND CONDUIT BACK TO PANELBOARD. THIS 
INCLUDES LUMINAIRES, SECURITY, AND COMMUNICATIONS 
DEVICES. 
NURSE CALL CONTROL PANEL IN ELECTRICAL ROOM 125 IS TO BE 
DEMOLISHED. REMOVE PANEL, NURSE CALL DEVICES, AND WIRES 
BACK TO SOURCE. 
COMMUNICATIONS WIRE, CONDUIT, AND CABLE TRAY SERVING 
LEVEL 06 SHALL BE DEMOLISHED. REMOVE BACK TO 
TELECOMMUNICATIONS RACK. 
THE OWNER SHALL REMOVE EXISTING ACTIVE ELECTRONICS 
FROM THE EXISTING TELECOM RACK 
THE CONTRACTOR SHALL MEET WITH THE OWNERS IT STAFF AND 
TAG ALL CABLES TO REMAIN IN THE TELECOM ROOM. THE CABLES 
SHALL BE WRAPPED IN CAUTION TAPE AND TAGGED - DO NOT CUT 
OR REMOVE - FOR THE DEMOLITION CONTRACTOR. 
THE CONTRACTOR SHALL CAREFULLY COIL THE EXISTING FIBER 
AND ENCLOSURE OVERHEAD AND OUT OF THE WAY DURING THE 
DEMOLITION TIME. THE EXISTING PANEL WILL BE RELOCATED TO 
THE TOP OF THE EXISTING RACK. 
ALL FIBER BACKBONE CABLES WILL BE RETESTED AND IF 
REQUIRED, RETERMINATED. 
EXISTING RACK AND VERTICAL WIRE MANAGEMENT TO BE SET 
ASSIDE DURING DEMO AND TO BE RE -INSTALLED AND REUSED. 
COORDINATE WITH DESIGNER EXACT LOCATION IN THE 
RENOVATED TELECOM TO INSURE CLEARANCES. 
EXISTING ACCESS CONTROL PANEL IS INSTALLED BUT NOT 
OPERATIONAL. CONTRACTOR SHALL RELOCATE THE EXISTING 
PANEL IN NEW WORK. 
EXISTING CARD READER AND DOOR HARDWARE ARE EXISTING 
BUT NOT OPERATIONAL. NOTED CARD READERS SHALL BE 
ACTIVATED AND CONNECTED TO RELOCATED ACCESS CONTROL 
PANEL IN NEW WORK.

ENERGY EFFICIENT TRANSFORMERS AND AUTOMATIC TRANSFER 
SWITCH ON LEVEL 06 ARE EXISTING TO REMAIN. SEE ENLARGED 
PLANS FOR LOCATION OF TRANSFORMERS AND ATS. 
CONTROL PANELS IN ELECTRICAL ROOM 125 ARE EXISTING TO 
REMAIN, UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED. 
TELECOMMUNICATIONS CHANNEL RACK THAT SERVES LEVEL 06 
ARE EXISTING TO REMAIN.

FOR LOCATION OF ALL CEILING FIXTURES.

ARCHITECTURAL REFLECTED CEILING PLANS PRIOR TO

SWITCHES, ONE FOR READING AND ONE FOR AMBIENT. 
SWITCH FOR READING SHALL BE CLOSEST TO THE PATIENT 
BED. MOUNT BOTH SWITCHES CLOSE TO BED AT A HEIGHT

NEW WORK GENERAL NOTES 
A. THE DRAWINGS SHALL NOT BE SCALED FOR CONSTRUCTION 
PURPOSES. THE SCALE, WHEN INDICATED IS INTENDED FOR  
REFERENCE PURPOSES ONLY. 
B. CONSTRUCTION DEBRIS SHALL BE REMOVED DAILY. 
C. COORDINATE LOCATIONS OF HVAC AND/OR PLUMBING EQUIPMENT 
WITH INSTALLER PRIOR TO EACH ROUGH -IN. MAKE ALL FINAL 
CONNECTIONS. 
D. ELECTRICAL AND FIRE ALARM CONTRACTORS ARE TO PROVIDE 
CONNECTIONS TO EACH FIRE/SMOKE DAMPER TO PERMIT PROPER 
OPERATION OF THE DAMPERS IN ALARM AND TEST MODES. FIRE 
DAMPERS REQUIRE POWER FOR ELECTRICAL RESET. REFER TO 
PANEL SCHEDULES FOR CIRCUIT NUMBER. 
E. FOR SYMBOLS AND GENERAL NOTES, REFER TO DRAWING E001. 
F. COORDINATE DEVICE LOCATIONS AND HEIGHT ABOVE FLOOR WITH 
ARCHITECTURAL DRAWINGS. 
G. LIFT OUTLETS SHALL BE MOUNTED AT 4" BELOW FINISHED CEILING. 
PROVIDE JUNCTION BOX ABOVE ACCESSIBLE CEILING FOR 
120V CONNECTION TO VAV CONTROLS FOR VAV 1 -1-1V, 1 -1-2V, 
1-1-3V, AND 1 -1-22V. 
PROVIDE JUNCTION BOX ABOVE ACCESSIBLE CEILING FOR 
120V CONNECTION TO VAV CONTROLS FOR VAV 1 -1-21C, 
1-1-20V, 1 -1-19V, AND 1 -1-17V. 
PROVIDE JUNCTION BOX ABOVE ACCESSIBLE CEILING FOR 
120V CONNECTION TO VAV CONTROLS FOR VAV 1 -1-16V, 
1-1-15V, 1 -1-14V AND 1 -1-18V. 
PROVIDE JUNCTION BOX ABOVE ACCESSIBLE CEILING FOR 
120V CONNECTION TO VAV CONTROLS FOR VAV 1 -1-13V, 
1-1-12V, 1 -2-10V, AND 1 -1-11V. 
PROVIDE JUNCTION BOX ABOVE ACCESSIBLE CEILING FOR 
120V CONNECTION TO VAV CONTROLS FOR VAV 1 -2-9V, 
1-2-11V, 1 -2-8V, AND 1 -2-7V. 
PROVIDE JUNCTION BOX ABOVE ACCESSIBLE CEILING FOR 
120V CONNECTION TO VAV CONTROLS FOR VAV 1 -2-4V, 1 -2-5V, 
1-2-6V, AND 1 -2-3V. 
PROVIDE JUNCTION BOX ABOVE ACCESSIBLE CEILING FOR 
120V CONNECTION TO VAV CONTROLS FOR VAV 1 -2-2V, 1 -2-1V, 
1-1-10V,  1 -1-8V AND 1 -1-9V. 
PROVIDE JUNCTION BOX ABOVE ACCESSIBLE CEILING FOR 
120V CONNECTION TO FIRE SMOKE DAMPER CONTROLS. 
PROVIDE MOTOR RATED SWITCH FOR 115V CONNECTION TO 
RECIRCULATION PUMP. MAKE ALL FINAL CONNECTIONS TO 
THE EQUIPMENT. 
PROVIDE INTEGRATED FURNITURE, USB OUTLETS IN 
ARCHITECTURAL CASEWORK AND FLOOR MOUNTED OUTLET 
TO POWER THEM. FLOOR MOUNTED OUTLET SHALL BE 
CONCEALED INSIDE CASEWORK. COORDINATE SELECTION 
AND FINISHES OF OUTLETS WITH ARCHITECT. COORDINATE 
ROUTING OF WIRE AND CONDUIT AND LOCATION OF FLOOR 
MOUNTED OUTLET WITH ARCHITECTURAL ELEVATIONS. 
PROVIDE 120V CONNECTION TO THE POWER SUPPY OF JERON 
790 NURSE CALL SYSTEM. 
PROVIDE TWO NEMA L21 -20A RECEPTACLES FOR DATA ROOM 
112. 
EXISTING ACCESS CONTROL PANEL SHALL BE RELOCATED TO 
THE LOCATION SHOWN. CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE 120V 
BRANCH CIRCUIT TO PANEL AS SHOWN IN PLAN. 
PROVIDE JUNCTION BOX ABOVE ACCESSIBLE CEILING FOR 
120V CONNECTION TO CARD READERS. CONNECT TO CIRCUIT 
10 IN PANEL ELP -C6 -1 (6LXA). 
PROVIDE JUNCTION BOX ABOVE ACCESSIBLE CEILING FOR 
120V CONNCTION TO VAV CONTROLS FOR VAV 1 -1-7V, 1 -1-6V, 
1-1-5V AND 1 -1-4V.

NEW WORK GENERAL NOTES 
NOTE 
AN "IT" PRE -SUBMITTAL MEETING WILL BE REQUIRED 
PRIOR TO SUBMITTAL REVIEW WITH VA "IT" REPRESENTATIVE 
AND AE. CONTRACTOR TO COORDINATE WITH 
CONTRACTING OFFICER'S REPRESENTATIVE 14 DAYS PRIOR 
TO MEETING. 
A. REFER TO SHEET E002 FOR SPECIAL SYSTEMS SYMBOLS, SCHEDULES 
AND NOTES. 
B. THE EXIT POINT OF ALL CONDUIT/SLEEVES POSITIONED HORIZONTALLY 
MUST BE FITTED WITH A CONDUIT WATERFALL TYPE SUPPORT SYSTEM 
SUCH AS THE PANDUIT CWF 400, OR APPROVED EQUIVALENT, TO 
CONTROL THE BEND RADIUS OF THE COMMUNICATION CABLE TO A 
MINIMUM OF A 4" RADIUS. 
C. ALL OUTLET LOCATIONS ARE IN APPROXIMATE POSITIONS. THE EXACT 
LOCATIONS SHALL BE DETERMINED BY PROVIDED BOX LOCATIONS AND 
FIELD CONDITIONS. ALL LOCATIONS SHALL BE FIELD VERIFIED PRIOR TO 
ROUGH IN. 
D. AN INDEPENDENT SUPPORT SUBSYSTEM FASTENED TO STRUCTURAL 
STEEL SHALL BE CREATED FOR THE STRUCTURED CABLING SYSTEM. 
CABLING SHALL BE SUPPORTED EVERY FOUR (4) TO FIVE (5) FEET 
WHEN EXITING BOTH HORIZONTAL AND VERTICAL RACEWAYS.
E. ALL THRU WALL OR THRU FLOOR PENETRATIONS AS WELL AS ANY 
CONDUIT PATHWAYS USED FOR THE STRUCTURED CABLING SYSTEM 
SHALL BE EITHER RETURNED TO THEIR NORMAL ORIGINAL INTEGRITY, 
IF THAT ORIGINAL CONDITION WAS DEFICIENT, IT SHALL BE BROUGHT 
UP TO STANDARDS, OR SHALL BE MADE WHOLE BY USE OF AN 
APPROPRIATE FIRE -RATED SYSTEM. ALL TELECOMMUNICATIONS 
SLEEVES FOR THIS PROJECT SHALL BE FIRE STOPPED. ALL EXTERIOR 
ENTRANCE CONDUITS SHALL BE PLUGGED WITH A WATER PROOF 
PLUG. 
F. ALL OUTLET LOCATIONS SHALL BE IDENTIFIED WITH A TIA/EIA 606 -A 
COMPLIANT LABELING SYSTEM. LABELING CONVENTIONS SHALL BE 
APPROVED BY THE OWNER PRIOR TO ORDERING LABELS. PROVIDE A 
LAMINATED 30" X 42" AS -BUILT DOCUMENT SHOWING ALL LABELS AT 
EACH OUTLET. THE DOCUMENT SHALL BE FRAMED AND POSTED IN THE 
TELECOM ROOM. 
G. ALL DRAWINGS ARE DIAGRAMMATIC. CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE 
COORDINATION DOCUMENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE 
SPECIFICATIONS. ADDITIONAL TRANSITIONS REQUIRED DUE TO FIELD 
CONDITIONS ARE THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE CONTRACTOR. 
H. ELECTRICAL DEVICES PROVIDED IN DIVISION 26 ARE SHOWN FOR 
COORDINATION PURPOSES ONLY. 
I. A PROPOSED CABLE TRAY ROUTING IS SHOWN TO ILLUSTRATE A 
FEASIBLE ROUTE BASED ON KNOWN OBSTACLES AND HAS BEEN 
COORDINATED WITH OTHER DISCIPLINES. CONTRACTOR SHALL SHALL 
PROVIDE AS -BUILT, BIM COORDINATED DRAWINGS TO BE DISCUSSED AT 
THE "IT" PRESUBMITTAL MEETING. ROUTING SHALL BE COORDINATED IN 
FIELD WITH OTHER TRADES. 
KEY PLAN: (NOT TO SCALE) 
AREA OF WORK 
OUTLET INSTALLED IN WALL MOUNTED FURNITURE SYSTEM.  
WALL PLATE FINISH SHALL BE BLACK OR STAINLESS STEEL 
TO COORDINATE WITH FURNITURE FINISH. 
PROVIDE WALL OUTLET FOR WALL MOUNTED PHONE. 
COORDINATE EXACT LOCATION WITH ARCHITECTURAL 
PLANS AND SIGNAGE. 
PROVIDE 2 -4" CONDUITS ABOVE ARCHITECTURAL CEILING 
FOR TELECOMMUNICATIONS WIRING. 
THE OWNER SHALL REMOVE EXISTING ACTIVE 
ELECTRONICS FROM THE EXISTING TELECOM RACK 
CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE FIRE RATED PATHWAY WITH 
THREE (3) - 4" OPENING FOR PASSAGE OF CABLING 
THROUGH RATED WALL. 
PROVIDE NEW FIBER OPTIC CABLE FROM ROOM 2C271 FOR 
CONNECTION TO THE NEW JERON 790 NURSE CALL SYSTEM. 
USE EXISTING LAN SWITCH PROVIDED FOR FUTURE USE. 
CONNECT GATEWAY FOR LEVEL 06 TO THE EXISTING NURSE 
CALL NURSE CALL GATEWAYS ON LEVEL 08 AND LEVEL 09 
FOR REMOTE SURVIVABILITY. 
EXISTING ACCESS CONTROL PANELS SHALL BE RELOCATED 
TO THE LOCATION SHOWN. CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE 
ALL WIRING AND INTEGRATION TO MAKE SYSTEM WHOLE 
AND FUNCTIONAL. 
CONNECT EXISTING CARD READER TO ACCESS CONTROL 
PANEL. SPLICE AND EXTEND AS REQUIRED.
